status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
kou opened a new pull request #2879: ARROW-3070: WIP: [Packaging] Use Bintray
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879
 
 
   dev/release/03-binary.sh uploads binaries (.deb, .rpm, .whl and conda
   .tar.bz2) to https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/ . It uses debian-rc,
   ubuntu-rc, centos-rc and python-rc packages on Bintray.
   
   dev/release/03-binary.sh signs and generates checksums binaries. This
   ignores signs and checksums generated by crossbow. Because we need
   some special signing. For example, .dsc and .changes should use inline
   sign instead of separated sign file. debsign command does this. .rpm
   should be signed by "rpm --addsign".
   
   dev/release/03-binary.sh also generates metadata to install .deb and
   .rpm files by apt and yum. See the changes for site/install.md how to
   use https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/ as APT and Yum repository.
   
   This means that this change includes work for
   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349 .
   
   We can install not only RC binaries but also released binaries by apt
   and yum. It will help us to verify binaries.
   
   dev/release/post-02-binary.sh downloads verified binaries at
   debian-rc, ubuntu-rc, centos-rc and python-rc packages on Bintray and
   uploads them to debian, ubuntu, centos and python packages on Bintray.
   
   APT and Yum repositories for RC and release are separated. So RC
   doesn't affect users.
   
   Release manager needs write access to https://bintray.com/apache/arrow .

kou commented on issue #2879: ARROW-3070: WIP: [Packaging] Use Bintray
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879#issuecomment-434578611
 
 
   I confirmed that this almost works well. But my Bintray account exceeded API limit. So I need to finish more tests. This is the reason why this pull request marks as WIP.
   
   I've uploaded binaries for 0.11.0-rc1 and 0.11.0-rc0 to https://bintray.com/apache/arrow . We can confirm the result for `dev/release/03-binary.sh`.

kou commented on issue #2879: ARROW-3070: WIP: [Packaging] Use Bintray
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879#issuecomment-434579695
 
 
   `03-binary.sh` needs to use some special commands such as `debsign`, `apt-ftparchive`, `rpm` and `createrepo`. So I also add `Dockerfile` to run them. It'll work on macOS but I didn't try yet.
   
   `03-binary.sh` requires recent GnuPG (maybe GnuPG >= 2.1). Because it uses `gpg-agent` to sign in Docker. It will require recent GnuPG.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

kou commented on issue #2879: ARROW-3070: WIP: [Packaging] Use Bintray
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879#issuecomment-434581244
 
 
   @kszucs I think that we move signing and checksum generation features to `dev/release/03-binary.sh` from crossbow because this task needs to run many external commands. So shell script may be better.
   
   If you think this should be implemented in crossbow, we can work on it as follow-up pull request.

kou commented on issue #2879: ARROW-3070: [Packaging] Use Bintray
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879#issuecomment-435586657
 
 
   Now, this pull request is ready to review.
   
   I've uploaded binaries for 0.11.0-rc1, 0.11.0, 0.11.1-rc0 and 0.11.1:
   
   For Debian GNU/Linux:
   
     * 0.11.0-rc1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/debian-rc/0.11.0-rc1#files
     * 0.11.0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/debian/0.11.01#files
     * 0.11.1-rc0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/debian-rc/0.11.1-rc0#files
     * 0.11.1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/debian/0.11.1#files
   
   For Ubuntu:
   
     * 0.11.0-rc1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/ubuntu-rc/0.11.0-rc1#files
     * 0.11.0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/ubuntu/0.11.01#files
     * 0.11.1-rc0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/ubuntu-rc/0.11.1-rc0#files
     * 0.11.1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/ubuntu/0.11.1#files
   
   For CentOS:
   
     * 0.11.0-rc1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos-rc/0.11.0-rc1#files
     * 0.11.0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos/0.11.01#files
     * 0.11.1-rc0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos-rc/0.11.1-rc0#files
     * 0.11.1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos/0.11.1#files
   
   For Python:
   
     * 0.11.0-rc1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/python-rc/0.11.0-rc1#files
     * 0.11.0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/python/0.11.01#files
     * 0.11.1-rc0: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/python-rc/0.11.1-rc0#files
     * 0.11.1: https://bintray.com/apache/arrow/python/0.11.1#files
   
   We can test the uploaded binaries for Debian GNU/Linux and Ubuntu by `apt`.
   
   For RC (I'll write this to Wiki when this pull request is merged):
   
   ```shell
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install -y -V apt-transport-https lsb-release
   sudo wget -O /usr/share/keyrings/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/$(lsb_release --id --short | tr 'A-Z' 'a-z')-rc/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg
   sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/apache-arrow.list <<APT_LINE
   deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg] https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/$(lsb_release --id --short | tr 'A-Z' 'a-z')-rc/ $(lsb_release --codename --short) main
   deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg] https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/$(lsb_release --id --short | tr 'A-Z' 'a-z')-rc/ $(lsb_release --codename --short) main
   APT_LINE
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install -y -V libarrow-dev # For C++
   sudo apt install -y -V libarrow-glib-dev # For GLib (C)
   sudo apt install -y -V libparquet-dev # For Apache Parquet C++
   sudo apt install -y -V libparquet-glib-dev # For Parquet GLib (C)
   ```
   
   For release (This is written in `site/install.md`):
   
   ```shell
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install -y -V apt-transport-https lsb-release
   sudo wget -O /usr/share/keyrings/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/$(lsb_release --id --short | tr 'A-Z' 'a-z')/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg
   sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/apache-arrow.list <<APT_LINE
   deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg] https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/$(lsb_release --id --short | tr 'A-Z' 'a-z')/ $(lsb_release --codename --short) main
   deb-src [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/apache-arrow-keyring.gpg] https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/$(lsb_release --id --short | tr 'A-Z' 'a-z')/ $(lsb_release --codename --short) main
   APT_LINE
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install -y -V libarrow-dev # For C++
   sudo apt install -y -V libarrow-glib-dev # For GLib (C)
   sudo apt install -y -V libparquet-dev # For Apache Parquet C++
   sudo apt install -y -V libparquet-glib-dev # For Parquet GLib (C)
   ```
   
   We can test the uploaded binaries for CentOS by `yum`:
   
   For RC (I'll write this to Wiki when this pull request is merged):
   
   ```shell
   sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/Apache-Arrow.repo <<REPO
   [apache-arrow]
   name=Apache Arrow
   baseurl=https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos-rc/\$releasever/\$basearch/
   gpgcheck=1
   enabled=1
   gpgkey=https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos-rc/RPM-GPG-KEY-apache-arrow
   REPO
   sudo yum install -y epel-release
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel arrow-devel # For C++
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel arrow-glib-devel # For GLib (C)
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-devel # For Apache Parquet C++
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-glib-devel # For Parquet GLib (C)
   ```
   
   For release (This is written in `site/install.md`):
   
   ```shell
   sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/Apache-Arrow.repo <<REPO
   [apache-arrow]
   name=Apache Arrow
   baseurl=https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos/\$releasever/\$basearch/
   gpgcheck=1
   enabled=1
   gpgkey=https://dl.bintray.com/apache/arrow/centos/RPM-GPG-KEY-apache-arrow
   REPO
   sudo yum install -y epel-release
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel arrow-devel # For C++
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel arrow-glib-devel # For GLib (C)
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-devel # For Apache Parquet C++
   sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=epel parquet-glib-devel # For Parquet GLib (C)
   ```
   
   We can upload binaries for RC by the following command line (I'll write this to Wiki when this pull is merged):
   
   ```console
   % BINTRAY_USER=${YOUR_BINTRAY_USER} BINTRAY_PASSWORD=${YOUR_BINTRAY_API_KEY} dev/release/03-binary.sh ${VERSION} ${RC} ${YOUR_GPG_KEY_ID} ${CROSSBOW_SIGN_OUTPUT_DIR}
   ```
   
   Example for uploading binaries for 0.11.0 RC1 by me:
   
   ```console
   % BINTRAY_USER=kou BINTRAY_PASSWORD=secret dev/release/03-binary.sh 0.11.0 1 08D3564B7C6A9CAFBFF6A66791D18FCF079F8007 packages/build-38
   ```
   
   We can upload binaries for voted release by the following command line (I'll write this to Wiki when this pull is merged):
   
   ```console
   % BINTRAY_USER=${YOUR_BINTRAY_USER} BINTRAY_PASSWORD=${YOUR_BINTRAY_API_KEY} dev/release/post-02-binary.sh ${VERSION} ${RC}
   ```
   
   Example for uploading binaries for 0.11.0 by me:
   
   ```console
   % BINTRAY_USER=kou BINTRAY_PASSWORD=secret dev/release/post-02-binary.sh 0.11.0 1
   ```
   
   You can try `03-binary.sh` and `post-02-binary.sh` by removing uploaded binaries. Because we don't provide binaries from bintray.com.
   
   Here is a command to remove uploaded binaries of 0.11.0 RC1 for Debian GNU/Linux:
   
   ```console
   % curl --verbose --fail --basic --user ${YOUR_BINTRAY_USER}:${YOUR_BINTRAY_API_KEY} --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --request DELETE https://bintray.com/api/v1/packages/apache/arrow/debian-rc/versions/0.11.0
   ```
   
   Here is a command to remove uploaded binaries of 0.11.1 for Python:
   
   ```console
   % curl --verbose --fail --basic --user ${YOUR_BINTRAY_USER}:${YOUR_BINTRAY_API_KEY} --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --request DELETE https://bintray.com/api/v1/packages/apache/arrow/python/versions/0.11.1
   ```
   
   Note that you can't try these scripts many times in a day because you can only do 1440 API calls per day. both `03-binary.sh` and `post-02-binary.sh` use about 500 API calls.

kou commented on issue #2879: ARROW-3070: [Packaging] Use Bintray
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879#issuecomment-437033043
 
 
   It makes sense.
   I've added `BINTRAY_REPOSITORY` environment variable.
   
   Now, you can try this with your Bintray repository.
   
   Here is an example to use https://bintray.com/kou/arrow :
   
   ```console
   % BINTRAY_REPOISITORY=kou/arrow ...
   ```
   
   Note that you need to create the following "package"s in your repository:
   
     * debian
     * debian-rc
     * ubuntu
     * ubuntu-rc
     * centos
     * centos-rc
     * python
     * python-rc
   
   See also: https://bintray.com/kou/arrow

-tag=apache-arrow-${version}

+if [ -z "${BINTRAY_PASSWORD}" ]; then

+docker_run() {

+    --tty \

+    --volume "$PWD":/host \
+    ${docker_image_name} \
+    bash -c "cd /host && $*"
+}
+
+docker_run_gpg_ready() {
+  local gpg_agent_socket_dir="$(gpgconf --list-dir socketdir)"
+  local uid=$(id -u)
+  local gid=$(id -g)
+  local commands="groupadd --gid ${gid} ${USER}"
+  commands="${commands} && useradd --uid ${uid} --gid ${gid} ${USER}"
+  commands="${commands} && chown ${USER}: /run/user/${uid}"
+  commands="${commands} && cd /host"
+  commands="${commands} && sudo -u ${USER} -H $*"
+  docker \
+    run \
+    --rm \
+    --tty \
+    --interactive \
+    --volume "$PWD":/host \
+    --volume "${HOME}/.gnupg:/home/${USER}/.gnupg:ro" \

   If I remove the readonly flag it works.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Since the artifacts are large this is a better place for them.
fields.summary: [Release] Host binary artifacts for RCs and releases on ASF Bintray account instead of dist/mirror system

comments.body: I've never used bintray befure, but there were descriptor.json files previously in arrow-dist. Will it be fully manual for 0.11?

We should do what Apache Aurora is doing

https://github.com/apache/aurora-packaging#hash-sign-and-upload-the-binaries

cc [~xhochy]

I'm working on the 0.11.1 release. I have 2 Mbit/s upload internet where I am now, but the dist system is maxing out around 1 Mbit/s, sometimes slower. Since our releases are rather large (a few hundred megabytes) we definitely should move to a more scalable place to put large binaries
